department.dept_long_name: Committee on Higher Degrees in Biostatistics

course.title: Statistical Methods for Causality
course.description: Theory of directed acyclic graph models. Identifiability of causal contrasts. Theory and applications of locally semiparametric efficient doubly-robust estimation in two models for counterfactual variables: marginal structural models and structural nested models.
course.prerequisites: Biostatistics 231, or permission of instructor required.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the School of Public Health as BIO 291.
